verses.verse: O Lord <S%H3068><s%> God, <S%H410><s%> to whom vengeance <S%H5360><s%> belongs; O God, <S%H410><s%> to whom vengeance <S%H5360><s%> belongs, show <S%H3313><s%> yourself.
Lift <S%H5375><s%> up yourself, you judge <S%H8199><s%> of the earth: <S%H776><s%> render <S%H7725><s%> a reward <S%H1576><s%> to the proud. <S%H1343><s%>
LORD, <S%H3068><s%> how <S%H5704><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> shall the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> how <S%H5704><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> shall the wicked <S%H7563><s%> triumph? <S%H5937><s%>

How long <S%H5704><s%> shall they utter <S%H5042><s%> and speak <S%H1696><s%> hard <S%H6277><s%> things? and all <S%H3605><s%> the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> boast <S%H559><s%> themselves?
They break <S%H1792><s%> in pieces your people, <S%H5971><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and afflict <S%H6031><s%> your heritage. <S%H5159><s%>
They slay <S%H2026><s%> the widow <S%H490><s%> and the stranger, <S%H1616><s%> and murder <S%H7523><s%> the fatherless. <S%H3490><s%>
Yet they say, <S%H559><s%> The LORD <S%H3050><s%> shall not see, <S%H7200><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shall the God <S%H430><s%> of Jacob <S%H3290><s%> regard <S%H995><s%> it.
Understand, <S%H995><s%> you brutish <S%H1197><s%> among the people: <S%H5971><s%> and you fools, <S%H3684><s%> when <S%H4970><s%> will you be wise? <S%H7919><s%>
He that planted <S%H5193><s%> the ear, <S%H241><s%> shall he not hear? <S%H8085><s%> he that formed <S%H3335><s%> the eye, <S%H5869><s%> shall he not see? <S%H5027><s%>
He that chastises <S%H3256><s%> the heathen, <S%H1471><s%> shall not he correct? <S%H3198><s%> he that teaches <S%H3925><s%> man <S%H120><s%> knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> shall not he know?
The LORD <S%H3068><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> the thoughts <S%H4284><s%> of man, <S%H120><s%> that they are vanity. <S%H1892><s%>
Blessed <S%H835><s%> is the man <S%H1397><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> you chasten, <S%H3256><s%> O LORD, <S%H3050><s%> and teach <S%H3925><s%> him out of your law; <S%H8451><s%>
That you may give him rest <S%H8252><s%> from the days <S%H3117><s%> of adversity, <S%H7451><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> the pit <S%H7845><s%> be dig <S%H3738><s%> for the wicked. <S%H7563><s%>
For the LORD <S%H3068><s%> will not cast <S%H5203><s%> off his people, <S%H5971><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> will he forsake <S%H5800><s%> his inheritance. <S%H5159><s%>
But judgment <S%H4941><s%> shall return <S%H7725><s%> to righteousness: <S%H6664><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the upright <S%H3477><s%> in heart <S%H3820><s%> shall follow <S%H310><s%> it.

Who <S%H4310><s%> will rise <S%H6965><s%> up for me against <S%H5973><s%> the evildoers? <S%H7489><s%> or who <S%H4310><s%> will stand <S%H3320><s%> up for me against <S%H5973><s%> the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity? <S%H205><s%>
Unless <S%H3884><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> had been my help, <S%H5833><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> had almost <S%H4592><s%> dwelled <S%H7931><s%> in silence. <S%H1745><s%>
When <S%H518><s%> I said, <S%H559><s%> My foot <S%H7272><s%> slips; <S%H4131><s%> your mercy, <S%H2617><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> held <S%H5582><s%> me up.
In the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of my thoughts <S%H8312><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> me your comforts <S%H8575><s%> delight <S%H8173><s%> my soul. <S%H5315><s%>
Shall the throne <S%H3678><s%> of iniquity <S%H1942><s%> have fellowship <S%H2266><s%> with you, which frames <S%H3335><s%> mischief <S%H5999><s%> by a law? <S%H2706><s%>
They gather <S%H1413><s%> themselves together against <S%H5921><s%> the soul <S%H5315><s%> of the righteous, <S%H6662><s%> and condemn <S%H7561><s%> the innocent <S%H5355><s%> blood. <S%H1818><s%>
But the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is my defense; <S%H4869><s%> and my God <S%H430><s%> is the rock <S%H6697><s%> of my refuge. <S%H4268><s%>

And he shall bring <S%H7725><s%> on them their own iniquity, <S%H205><s%> and shall cut <S%H6789><s%> them off in their own wickedness; <S%H7451><s%> yes, the LORD <S%H3068><s%> our God <S%H430><s%> shall cut <S%H6789><s%> them off.
